featured.text: To talk to the patient and ease his/her worries.
Research shows that 31 amounts of exercise—even just 15 minutes a day—helps ease depression, enhance self-image, relieve stress, and much more.
Fixing your eyes on the person will make him/her feel at ease.
The report concludes with an earnest request to international policymakers to distribute financial and other resources to ease the regional crisis.
The ease of transportation to the Pacific islands. 46.

definition.zh_def: 舒適，輕鬆，減輕痛苦或困難的狀態或過程。
definition.en_def: The state of being comfortable or free from worry; to make something less severe or difficult.
definition.example: She took a deep breath to ease her nerves before the presentation.
